alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; McHenry; Pierce; Renville; Rolette; Ward (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 3:23AM CST until December 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches possible. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Dakota, including areas along and north of Highway 2. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon CST today. * IMPACTS...For Sunday afternoon through Monday morning, roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Today, and through next week, dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Bottineau; McHenry; Pierce; Renville; Rolette; Ward
